subject: Katie Couric Interviews Larry King Tonight!
body:
Tonight On CNN Email







May  2, 2007








 





9 p.m. ET


 

Larry King Live: 50 Years in Broadcasting


Katie Couric takes over Larry's chair and asks the King of Talk all the things you want to know as we celebrate Larry's 50 years in broadcasting. Watch CNN tonight at 9 p.m. ET.












Related:• DeGeneres hosting show from hospital bed







 
 





 




6:00 a.m. ET


 

American Morning


Controversial research for a rare disease. Could it spell hope for those suffering from Lou Gehrig's disease?










 





6:00 p.m. ET


 

Lou Dobbs Tonight


Lou Dobbs draws the line on illegal immigration live from a small town. Find out what they're doing to fight broken borders.







7:00 p.m. ET


 

The Situation Room


Former C.I.A. Director George Tenet calls out the Bush Administration on prewar intelligence, but why has he waited until now? Find out tonight.







8:00 p.m. ET


 

Lou Dobbs Prime-time Special: Broken Borders


Lou Dobbs is live in Hazleton, PA where the immigration fight heats up. Find out what they're doing to fight broken borders, in a prime-time special.







9:00 p.m. ET


 

Larry King Live


Katie Couric flips the script and asks Larry all the things you want to know as we celebrate Larry's 50 years in broadcasting.







10:00 p.m. ET


 

Anderson Cooper 360


The popularity of the TV show CSI has now influenced the way some juries think. Anderson Cooper investigates why the CSI effect may be a dangerous thing.
